reasoning: HTLV-1-associated myelopathy/tropical spastic paraparesis (HAM/TSP) is rare globally at ~0.05 per 100k, but higher in endemic regions (Caribbean, Japan). 0.3-3% of HTLV-1 carriers develop HAM/TSP over lifetime.
source: Gessain A, Cassar O. (2012). Epidemiological aspects and world distribution of HTLV-1 infection. Front Microbiol. 3:388
